Привет всем дорогие друзья)!!
В своей рекомендации я расскажу вам о игре под названием "Portal 2".
Эта игра, как и ее предшественник, "Portal" создана для развития вас и вашего ума, способности мыслить неординарно!!!
Вобще вся суть этой игры в том, чтобы выбраться на ружу. Вы играете за девушку, которую оставили в камере хранения, как и всех других, после распада компании. Но вас пробуждает один веселый, как вы потом узнаете, дрон. Он попытается вывести вас из этого старого и трухлявого комплекса. Вообще игра состоит из, если я не ошибаюсь, 11 или 12 глав, а то и больше.
В каждой главе вы будете проходить, разного рода, испытания.
Например в 1 главе вы получите портальную пушку и пробудите главный мозг компании, который вы убили в первой главе(утверждать не могу потому, что в первую часть не играл).
Далее она заставит проходить вас разные испытания и будет мучить на каждом из них, подшучивая и усложняя вам испытания.
Но в один прекрасный момент вы сбежите из подопытных камер и смените ее на того мелкого дрона, который вас пробудил.
И тут он вас предаст!!!(поробности объяснять не стану будет не интересно играть)
Вообщем на этом и начинается сама долгая и довольно интересная игра.
1. Вам может показаться, что прохождение камер испытаний это довольно нудно и быстро надоедает, но могу оспорить это, когда вы впервый раз пройдете камеру вам захочется узнать, что будет во второй потом в третьей и т.д. Также вам захочется узнать как закончится сюжет, ведь он довольно запутанный и очень интересный.
2. Обстановку в игре разбавляет и речь ваших помошьников, а так же противников. Именно из-за речи героев в игре она становится такой забавной. Все герои в этой игре почти на всем протяжении игры несут всякую чущь. Это реально очень смешно.
3. Эта игра для более взрослых людей, тех кто умеет неординарно мыслить и знает много всего, если вы посадите играть в эту игру ребенка (до стадии подростка), то он не пройдет даже первую главу, да и не поймет всего юмора.
4. Четвертая особенность этой игры, то что она не жрет слишком много, почти на любом компе или ноуте в нее можно играть на максимальных настройках графики. Кароче, для этой класной игры не нужно много крутых деталий таких как: видеокарта, процессор и т.д.
5. это естественно незабываемый геймплей. Порталы, а это главная особенность игры, просто перевернут реальность с ног на голову, эта игра просто взорвет ваш мозг и мировозрение воей не реальностью и необычностью.
6. У этой игры, что не мало важно, есть мастерская стим, откуда вы сможете загружать себе новые уровни и многое другое.
Вообщем эта игра обязательно понравится и подросткам и взрослым, конечно тем, которые умеют мыслить.
У этой игры нет множества дополнений, которые вам захотелось бы купить для персонализации, зато к этой игре как я выше сказал прилагается мастерская стим, которая сможет порадовать вас новыми добавлениями в игру.
Я рекомендую вам эту игру и обещаю вам, что вас она обязательно удивит и порадует своей, прежде всего, необычностью!!!
Спасибо всем, кто прочитал мою рекомендацию, и если кто-то не нащел здесь то, что искал пишите в коменты, и я вам все подробно объясню и расскажу, а также буду больше знать, что вас интересует!!!!
Надеюсь вам понравилось))!

I immediately loved the concept of Portal 2: Science experiments as a premise to have fun and exercise you brain. The idea of the Portal gun is simple, but effective. One orange, One blue, you enter one and exit at the other. I did the walk through in solo and in co-op with a friend. Brilliant. Portal 2 adds some nice touch to Portal original experience, with more complicated puzzles and more ways to solve them. So far, I only missed puzzles that required deep coordination of the co-op partners. It was mostly static decisions, where timing was not an issue. Anyway, with the Steam workshop and the Portal tools distributed to the community, you have hours to spend solving 300,000 puzzles. Or build your own. For Science.

The single player did something I thought i would have never witness. It made the robots feel utterly alive and deep with emotional expressions. It is at least a 5 hour speedrun from what I have heard but a very great ride indeed.

For those who enjoyed Portal 1 and are afraid that this game isn't that much of a improvement. Fear not for this game delievers tons of new elements within their puzzles. Like gravity rays and cubes that reflect lazors. Along with tons of other neat additions. 

The co-op in this game takes place after you beat the game in single player. Which is well thought out and creative addition to the game. That makes partners relay on each other in order to reach their goal. 

Overall I would say Portal 2 did something that is not really done well before. Made creative and innovative designs to their game which allow partners relay on each other to navigate through the maps and the story itself.

Fantastic in every respect - completely hilarious (I was literally laughing so hard I almost fell out of my chair) and witty, thoroughly engaging and interesting, challenging, thought-provoking, and of course: fun.

It's too often that a sequel to a good game simply doesn't live up - however, i'm happy to report this does not even come close to falling under that umbrella.  In every respect - with the exception of the credits song, as the original is unbeatable - this sequal is superior to the original.

I entirely recommend this game. 

It builds on the ingenuity of the first game, and the puzzles are challenging and fun to play. I was only hopelessly lost during one of the last puzzles, and needed my roommate to help me out, but otherwise it was just straight-forward enough to figure out. Without revealing too much, Valve did a great job of extending the format and the storyline of the game by adding much larger, detailed environments and new items that be used to help solve puzzles.

On a side note, the dialogue in the game is wonderfully witty and tongue-in-cheek. Great feeling overall.

Translate and rewritten from Portuguese. Revised in 2022/04/19.

Portal 2 is definitely one of my favorite games.

Stellar storytelling that keeps the player captivated every single minute. 
As Chell you never say a single word, the typical mute protagonist. Something that does not hinder the experience by any means.
Wheatley is fun and GLaDoS's personality shift is frankly amazing.
The graphics aren't realistic for today's standards but they are beautiful, especially since Hammer / Source 1 (P2 Build) features raytracing for baked lighting. 
The result is a game that performs very well on all systems. Unless your CPU doesn't have the instructions necessary to run the game 😛

There is the possibility to create your own chambers or download others' from the workshop. This paired with the co-op makes for a very replayable experience.
The latter of which is lots of fun, grab a friend and enjoy it.

Almost every interaction in the game results in dynamic changes to the soundtrack. Flying through a portal, adds up to the intensity of the soundtrack. Jumping from a platform... And so on.
The OST is always adapting to every moment and every action that you do. This is something that, to this day, only a few game developers do.

The difficulty curve is very satisfying, once you get the grip of it, you'll figure everything out. Valve made sure to watch people play the game and figure out exactly in which ways they could throw all sorts of hints at you without spoiling the experience entirely.

I guarantee that playing this game is a mindblowing and unforgettable experience, I definitely recommend checking it out if you haven't already.

To this date, it is unknown whether Valve will ever release a prequel or a sequel, but it would very, very welcoming.
Let's hope this IP does not get forgotten like Half-Life almost did...
Portal is just one of the biggest classics of its generation. A enjoyable story, charismatic characters, good gameplay and challenge. It's a memorable adventure.

This sequel was a triumph. It seemed impossible to reclaim the spontaneity, the sheer WOW of the original Portal. And it was. And better yet, Valve realised this, so they did not simply copy the first game and try to do more of the same. No, they realised EXACTLY how to make a good sequel. The new mechanics fit seamlessly into the gameplay, the plot continues with more good writing. The humour is different - it has to be, for the original style would no longer work, but it remains extremely funny. THe writing is still impeccable.

And the co-op mode is extremely well done, and great fun. Though it can only be played safely by two players, NEITHER or BOTH of which have played it before.

Quantum-Space holes, panels, fancy beams, colored gels, companion cubes, regular cubes, be part of cruel and unscrupulous human testing (all for science), messing with sarcastic psychopath artificial intelligence, long falls, hot mute chicks, singing combat turrets, potato science, twisted sense of humor, the promise of $60, space robots, Jonathan Coulton...
If you like all that stuff then Portal 2 it's your game!!
Awsome! My favorite!

Fun and challenging game. Single player is great and is challenging and stimulating, but co-op is even better. Having to work with a partner is a lot of fun. I would definitely recommend co-op. Little to no lag as well.

Level editor is limited, but fun. I made a few interesting levels that sort of did what I wanted, but could definitely see that somethings I wanted to do would not be possible using the built-in editor.

All in all, a great game. 9.5/10

Les plus : 
- les gels, les bumpers, ponts de lumière tangible et lasers (dont l'utilisation a été améliorée depuis le premier opus)
- le multi (possibilité de faire de bonnes parties avec des amis)
- les graphismes (nette amélioration depuis le 1)
- la campagne solo (pour en apprendre plus sur Chell et GlaDos) avec sa bande son superde et son humour garanti !
- les chambres créées par la communauté

Les moins : 
- la difficulté moins élevée que dans le premier opus, sauf dans certaines chambres multi
- l'absence des "Pneumatic Diversity Vent" dans les chambres tel qu'on pouvait les voir dans certains teasers

En gros, un très bon jeu intelligent à recommander (et à acheter lors des soldes Steam), qui saura vous occuper durant plusieurs dizaines d'heures ;)

This may be my favorite game of all time.  The story, visuals, characters, and puzzles are all great.  The humor is also very good, and I highly suggest this game.  Do yourself a favor and pick up the original, as well.

Probably the best Co-Op experience I've ever had.

You don't realise this till you're bashing your head on the keyboard on the 8th time you get dropped by your idiot friend who refuses to just let you fly through the turbine and hit the switch because he's getting more joy from watching you get increasingly frustrated at being dropped. Its the moment when figure out a puzzle together and watch it fall into place. Its almost every single moment from the start to the final bit where you bash keys in a sad attempt to figure out how to end the game, you hug and everything falls into place. 

The core game is still the same - throw portals, fly through them and solve puzzles on teh way. What makes it magical is the hilarious voice acting - thank you Ellen Mclain, Stephen Merchant and  J.K. Simmons for outstanding work. The story is woven into the game as per Valve's signature style - and is all the better for it. The puzzles keep your head scratching and reward good honest work. And it runs just the perfect length.

What's irritating though? How the game contrives to have boss battles - almost as a final act for the sake of a final act. It doesn't add especially much to the game and merely serves to wrap up the plot.
A really great puzzle game that also manages to be hilarious with an engaging story.
Awesome game, very funny game. Recommend to play the co-op mode.

Coming from the first Portal with high expectations, none of them were met. If you think you'd like this game, go buy the original Portal. It is MUCH, much better. The gameplay drags on and I wasn't bothered to finish it as it got boring quite quickly. This is from the perspective of someone who has only played the single-player though, the co-op might be good, yet I am not bothered to play it because I suspect it's much like the single-player.

As you can probably assume from the hours I've played Portal 2, I have a fair amount of experience with it. Portal 2, as the sequel to Portal, goes into much more depth of the characters, featured in Portal, in the story mode, as well as introducing new ones. In addition to the story mode, you have hours of gameplay in the Community Maps, Co-Op, and Challenge Mode. Community Maps allow for users to make maps, or play maps. You could challange your friend, or even play with them in Co-Op. Co-op play features it's own little storyline, and also can run community co-op maps. Last, Challenge Mode allows you to race your friends, or compete globally to be the fastest person to play a level, or use the fewest portals to solve a challenge. These features add so much more gameplay than the original game (which was rather short), enticing players to play more, and have fun. Portal 2 is my go-to game if I'm ever bored, or feeling the need to test.
Does everythying the first game does, but better. There is also support for community maps and coop multiplayer.

Portal 2 is a great game, but it gets annoying for me at times when there is only about four atoms space of wall which you can shoot a portal on, so I just looked around the area knowing exactly what I'm supposed to do but having no way to do it. Also, (and this is just my opinion) I thought Wheatly was much funnier before SPPPPPPPPPPPPOILERS happened.
Again, it is a fantastic game, but I think the first is still slightly (very, very slightly) better overall.
